text: A cricket match in Edinburgh was abandoned after football fans en route to a Rangers vs Manchester United friendly allegedly abused and assaulted Murrayfield DAFS Cricket Club players. text: The Women's Asia Cup T20 saw Sri Lanka and Bangladesh secure victories against Malaysia and Thailand, respectively, bringing them closer to semifinal berths. Sri Lanka thrashed Malaysia by 114 runs, with Chamari Athapaththu scoring an unbeaten 119. Their bowlers then restricted Malaysia to 40 runs. In the second match, Thailand posted 96/9, with Nattaya Boochatham scoring 40. Bangladesh chased the target easily, reaching 100/3 in 17.3 overs, led by Murshida Khatun's 50. Both teams now lead Group B with four points each.

text: The International Cricket Council Annual Conference concluded in Colombo on Monday with the world body forming a three-member committee to review the conduct of T20 World Cup held in Americas last month. text: Akshay Kumar has had a notable Bollywood career since his debut in 1991, experiencing both highs and lows. Recently, several of his films, including Sarfira, underperformed at the box office. However, fans are hopeful for his next film, 'Khel Khel Mein', directed by Mudassar Aziz. In a Forbes India interview, Akshay discussed changing audience preferences and emphasized the importance of selecting entertaining and unique projects that resonate with current times. He highlighted his discipline and work ethic as his greatest strengths, adhering to a strict schedule for sleeping, eating, and working, and staying fit both physically and mentally. On the professional front, Sarfira, a Hindi remake of the Tamil film Soorarai Pottru, features Akshay as Vir Mhatre, who dreams of starting a low-cost airline. Akshay's upcoming projects include 'Khel Khel Mein', releasing on August 15, and 'Jolly LLB 3', directed by Subhash Kapoor, alongside Arshad Warsi and Huma Qureshi.
title: Akshay admits to being ‘More Mindful’ of film choices

text: A recent study proposes that time might not be a fundamental aspect of the universe but rather an illusion stemming from quantum entanglement. This new perspective aims to address the inconsistencies between our best theories of the universe, which have hindered the development of a unified "theory of everything." Researchers have suggested that by considering time as a result of quantum entanglement, the mysterious connection between two distant particles, they might solve this long-standing problem. The study, published on May 10 in the journal Physical Review A, explores this idea.
title: Is time an illusion created by quantum entanglement? A new perspective

text: On Aug. 24, 2023, more than three decades after the first confirmation of planets beyond our own solar system, scientists announced the discovery of six new exoplanets, stretching that number to 5,502. From zero exoplanet confirmations to over 5,500 in just a few decades, this new milestone marks another major step in the journey to understand the worlds beyond our solar system.The DiscoveryWith the discovery of six new exoplanets, scientists have tipped the scales and surpassed 5,500 exoplanets found (there are now 5,502 known exoplanets, to be exact).Just about 31 years ago, in 1992, the first exoplanets were confirmed when scientists detected twin planets Poltergeist and Phobetor orbiting the pulsar PSR B1257+12. In March 2022, just last year, scientists celebrated passing 5,000 exoplanets discovered.Key Facts Scientists have discovered six new exoplanets — HD 36384 b, TOI-198 b, TOI-2095 b, TOI-2095 c, TOI-4860 b, and MWC 758 c — this has pushed the total number of confirmed exoplanets discovered to 5,502.
title: Exploring Nasa's latest exoplanet marvels: 6 fascinating discoveries unveiled

text: Scientists discovered high levels of cocaine in Brazilian sharpnose sharks off Rio de Janeiro, raising concerns about behavioural impacts. The study found chronic exposure, with cocaine concentrations up to 100 times higher than in other marine animals. Potential sources include drug lab drainage or untreated sewage. This marks the first evidence of cocaine in free-ranging sharks, with further studies required.
title: Cocaine sharks: Brazilian study shows marine predators 'high' on drug

text: Britain's Conservative party will announce its new leader on November 2, following former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's resignation after a historic electoral defeat. The leadership race will culminate in an online vote in October.
title: Conservatives to announce new leader on November 2 after historic defeat
